info.headline: Dust Advisory issued July 13 at 7:56PM MST until July 13 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona...
* Until 930 PM MST.
* At 756 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was located 8 miles south of Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, moving northwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong winds in excess of 40 mph.
SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* Locations impacted include... Tucson, Oro Valley, Marana, Sahuarita, Green Valley, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Casas Adobes, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Tanque Verde, Vail, Corona De Tucson, South Tucson, Three Points, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, East Sahuarita, San Xavier Community, Tucson International Airport, Summit and Catalina Foothills.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 19 between mile markers 38 and 63. Route 86 between mile markers 156 and 171. Route 77 between mile markers 70 and 77. Interstate 10 between mile markers 249 and 293. Route 83 between mile markers 44 and 58.
info.instruction:
Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
